Class HighScores

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • HighScores
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class HighScores
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The HighScores class is the class that generates and outputs the high scores of the top 10 scores to an output file. The user can also print out a copy of the high scores.
    Version:
    5 06.09.15 Time Spent by Jasmine Ou: none. Time Spent by Laura Wong: 4 hours.

    name: HighScores.java

    Instance variables:

    currentScores This is a String array that stores the high scores.

    currentNames This is a String array that stores the names.

    currentDifficulty This is a String array that stores the difficulties.

    input This is a BufferedReader variable that allows reading files to be done.

    line This String variable is used to see if there are any scores stored in the file.

    printButton This print button is used to print the high scores.

    doneButton This done button says that the user is done with viewing the high scores and returns to the main menu.

    Author:
    Laura Wong
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • displayScores

        public void displayScores(java.awt.Graphics g)
        The displayScores method reads the high scores from the file HighScores.txt, ensures that there are scores in there and displays them. The try block is used to try and read into the high scores file. The if statement is used to check to see if the input.readLine() (the first line) is null or not. The for loop is used to draw the number of scores onto the JPanel. The printButton has an ActionListener with it that makes a new PrintHighScores when it is pushed.

        Local variables:

        numScores This is an int variable that counts the number of scores in the file.

        bg This is the image variable for the backround image for the high scores.

        x This is the image variable for the backround image for the high scores.

        IOException This is when an error occurs with file io where the file cannot be read.

        Parameters:
        g - This is the Graphics variable to draw the text onto the panel.

      • getCurrentScores

        public java.lang.String getCurrentScores(int x)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • updateScores

        public void updateScores(int score,
                         java.lang.String name,
                         int level)
        The updateScores method processes and updates the scores by sorting them. The first try block is used to attempt to read into the file. The next try block is used to add all the values in the file into the array currentScores The first two if statements are used to check to see if there are any scores in file, if there are it will check to see if there are 11 or not. The for loop is used to add all of the scores into the arrays. The next two for loops are used for sorting the numbers in the array in descending order. The try block is used to try and output to the file. The if statement is used to see if there are 11 scores or 10 (becuse it only outputs 10). The next if statement is for displaying one score if there is only one score. Else, the last for loop is used to output all of the scores in the arrays.

        Local variables:

        numScores This is an int variable that counts the number of scores in the file.

        playerName This is a String array that keeps track of the player names

        scoreArray This is an int array that keeps track of the player's scores.

        difficultyArray This is an int array that keeps track of the player's difficulty.

        tempDiff This is an integer number that keeps track of the temp difficulty.

        output This is a PrintWriter variable that lets printing to files allowed.

        currentScore This is the current score that is being worked with in the for loop.

        tempName This is the name that is associated with the current score.

        x This variable is being used throughout the processing of the sorting.

        w This is the integer variable used in the first for loop.

        j This is the integer variable used in the second for loop.

        q This is the integer variable used in the last for loop.

        IOException This is when an error occurs with file io where the file cannot be read.

        Parameters:
        score - This is the score that will be used for the highscorers (if in the top 10).
        name - This is the String storing the username.
        level - This is the int storing the level.
